texts.value: Transcription factor that binds specifically to the W box (5'-(T)TGAC[CT]-3'), a frequently occurring elicitor-responsive cis-acting element. Has a positive role in resistance to necrotrophic pathogens (e.g. Botrytis cinerea), but a negative effect on plant resistance to biotrophic pathogens (e.g. Pseudomonas syringae)
In young, mature and senescent leaves

By biotic and abiotic stresses such as pathogen infection (e.g. Botrytis cinerea and Pseudomonas syringae), salicylic acid (SA), jasmonic acid (JA), ethylene (ACC), liquid infiltration or spraying, and strongly during leaf senescence
Increased sensitivity to the necrotrophic fungal pathogen Botrytis cinerea

citation.title: Evidence for an important role of WRKY DNA binding proteins in the regulation of NPR1 gene expression.
Sequence and analysis of chromosome 1 of the plant Arabidopsis thaliana.
Araport11: a complete reannotation of the Arabidopsis thaliana reference genome.
Empirical analysis of transcriptional activity in the Arabidopsis genome.
A new member of the Arabidopsis WRKY transcription factor family, AtWRKY6, is associated with both senescence- and defence-related processes.
Roles of Arabidopsis WRKY3 and WRKY4 transcription factors in plant responses to pathogens.

referencePositions: INDUCTION BY BIOTIC AND ABIOTIC STRESSES
